settings.title: up to local network
settings.text: You just came from there! We're not at our destination yet.

settings.title: to ocean
settings.text: The ocean looks beautiful! But there aren't any cables leading under it from here.

lines.speaker: notice
lines.text: Mike has joined your conversation.

lines.speaker: Box
lines.text: "hello"

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: G'day, the name's Mike. Mike the Minecart.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Lemme guess, you're a packet looking for a ride through these here underground cables, aye?

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: yeah, actually, we're headed to the US eventually, but I think we have to get to Auckland first.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Well you're out of luck, I've been rusted to these tracks for years.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: wait, why are we underground again?

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: what is this place?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: You're at the entrance to the dirtiest part of the internet.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Down here under the earth is where a lot of the internet actually is, or at least where all your data travels through to get from here to there.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Kind of funny, actually.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Down here is where most of ores and other raw materials come from to make these fibre optic cables.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: (along with everything else electronic)

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Those weird humans dig it all up just to put it back in down here, only in a different place and more toxic configuration.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: well if this dude is rusted to the tracks I guess we're going to have to find a way to get Mike's wheels un-stuck if your packet is going to have any chance of making it over to me.

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: yeah... hmmm well I took a roadtrip up to Taranaki not that long ago and learned they actually drill oil around there, even though most of Aotearoa (New Zealand)'s energy is harvested from hydroelectric power.

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: It's just a bit north of here, maybe we can nab some oil around there to grease up those wheels?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: These rails are treacherous!

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: No packet's going to get through safely on their own!

lines.speaker: Box
lines.text: "hello"

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: However...

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: If you want to get to the oil fields you might be able to walk along that there service path to a router that connects to the oil companies' local network up in Taranaki.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: I think this guy might have a few screws loose

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: but let's check it out anyway!

lines.speaker: Box
lines.text: "hello"

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: dang not this again

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: this internet travel guide beeps?

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: I guess it's weirdly sentient or something, it must be trying to tell us something about this place

settings.title: WELCOME TO THE TARANAKI OIL FIELDS!!!!
settings.text: WELCOME TO THE TARANAKI OIL FIELDS!!!!

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: aaaaa!!

settings.title: WELCOME TO THE TARANAKI OIL FIELDS!!!!
settings.text: If you've ended up here, you're probably one lost packet! what are you doing outside of the packetsphere? well since you're here we might as well use this as an opportunity to learn a bit more about where the internet *really* comes from.

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: oh?

settings.title: WELCOME TO THE TARANAKI OIL FIELDS!
settings.text: The internet, and just about all of the things that make it up require energy to run. Since all of these routers, computers, data centers, mobile devices etc. are also scattered all around the globe, these individual pieces of technology rely mostly on their local power grids to get that energy. So as different places harvest energy in different ways, the energy "diet" of the internet changes depending on where you are.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: Hmm, so I guess what it "costs" to use the internet depends not only on where *you're* using it, but where you're *connecting* to with the internet, and all the places that connection is traveling through along its journey.

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: and I suppose that's only one layer of the cost, but even that layer must get pretty complicated pretty quickly, especially with a long chain like ours.

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: sometimes it feels complicated enough wondering where the electricity comes to run the toaster in my house... but this is...

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: yeah with the internet it's like your toaster, my toaster and everybody's toaster in between.

lines.speaker: Guide
lines.text: That's a lot of toast!! Or in this case it's a lot of kilowatt hours per gigabyte.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: wait, you talk?

lines.speaker: Guide
lines.text: Anyways, if you're looking for oil I'm sure Todd Energy won't mind if you borrow one of their oil drums, there's a little one around here somewhere...

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: this is a weirdly interactive travel pamphet!

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: now if only I could remember where I put that little oil drum in the code...

settings.title: That's not oil
settings.text: That's not an oil drum! Look around and try again.

settings.title: That's not oil
settings.text: That's the wrong kind of drum!

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: there it is!!

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: it's not much but it should be enough to clear that rust from Mike's wheels.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: well, it's also a little bit on fire, but hopefully Mike won't mind... let's go back down to the mines!

lines.speaker: Box
lines.text: "hello"

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: how's it going?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Oh you know, same old same old, still stuck to the tracks.

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: here, I think maybe this might help your wheels...

settings.title: Uhhh...
settings.text: You... you definitely shouldn't do that. Just give the oil to Mike.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Say... that's feeling pretty good!... whoo hoo!!! I'm free!

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Hey, what was your name again?

lines.speaker: Box
lines.text: "hello"

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Well listen, I owe ya big time. Any time you need a ride through these here underground cable mines you just give me a holler!

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: In fact, I'll take you up to the surface right now! You're headed towards the authoritative DNS nameserver for [[redacted]], right?

lines.speaker: Becky
lines.text: wait, how did you know that?

lines.speaker: Box
lines.text: "hello"

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: You just tell me when you're ready, and we'll head out.

lines.speaker: Zak
lines.text: ha – "head out"! now my head can take off up to Auckland!

settings.text: HOP IN THE CART AND RIDE UP TO AUCKLAND?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Alright, hang on tight! Sky City, here we come!
